definition: member of the US House of Representatives
abbr. for 眾議院|众议院[Zhong4 yi4 yuan4], House of Representatives

sentences.english: There is one member for approximately every 650,000 citizens.
sentences.chinese: 大约每65万公民产生一位众议员。

sentences.english: It takes a simple majority of representatives’ votes to impeach an official.
sentences.chinese: 弹劾案的通过只需要过半众议员投赞成票。

sentences.english: State Assemblyman Jimmy Meng and City Councilman John Liu attended the meeting.
sentences.chinese: 州众议员孟广瑞和市议员刘醇逸皆出席了会议。

sentences.english: Vacancies in the House of Representatives are filled only by a special election or in a general election.
sentences.chinese: 众议员补缺要通过专门选举或随大选进行。

sentences.english: Esther Yang, who is running for New York State Assemble 74th District, visited CCBA.
sentences.chinese: 有意参选纽约州74选区众议员的杨天发访中华公所。

sentences.english: Wang Jinhai(Chareman of the Board of Directors), met the deputies of Nigerian senators and members of House of Representatives.
sentences.chinese: 王金海先生会见尼日利亚参众议员代表。

sentences.english: Representative Smith wants raise the campaign-finance issue in the House as soon as possible.
sentences.chinese: 史密斯众议员还想尽快在众议院提出竞选资金问题。

sentences.english: The House of Representatives has how many voting members?
sentences.chinese: 众院能有投票权的众议员有多少位？

sentences.english: The House just defeated a 700-billion-dollar financial industry bailout package.
sentences.chinese: 美国众议员否决了七千亿美元的经济紧急援助方案。

sentences.english: Defiant no longer, Weiner resigns in sex scandal.
sentences.chinese: 美国众议员安东尼韦纳因性丑闻宣布辞职。

sentences.english: However, Rep. Boucher says he's leaning toward opt-out.
sentences.chinese: 不过，众议员鲍彻说，他对退出倾向。

definition: Nancy Pelosi (1940-), US Democrat politician from California, speaker of US House of Representatives from 2007
abbr. for 參議院|参议院[can1 yi4 yuan4], senate/upper chamber (of legislative assembly)
